alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; McIntosh; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of McIntosh, southeastern Wagoner, southwestern Cherokee, Muskogee, southern Okmulgee and southeastern Okfuskee Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 714 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northeast of Muskogee to 4 miles northeast of Wetumka. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Okmulgee... Henryetta... Fort Gibson... Checotah... Haskell... Morris... Weleetka... Dewar... Okay... Porter... Schulter... Oktaha... Braggs... Taft... Boynton... Grayson... Council Hill... Hanna... Rentiesville... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 227 and 270. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
